intro: Carthamodes pinnata, commonly known as the golden cupflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has feathery, finely divided leaves that give it a delicate appearance. It typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as wetlands and stream banks. Carthamodes pinnata is an important nectar source for pollinators like bees and butterflies.
